column2: cantáte Dòmino, omnis terra. ^ Sing ye to the Lord a new canticle~
column3: sing to the Lord, all the earth.

column1: 2 ^ Cantáte Dòmino, et benedícite nómini ejus~
column2: adnuntiáte de die in diem salutáre ejus. ^ Sing ye to the Lord, and bless his name~
column3: show forth his salvation from day to day.

column2: in òmnibus pòpulîs mirabìlia ejus. ^ Declare his glory among the Gentiles~

column1: 4 ^ Qŭóniam magnus Dòminus, et laŭdábilis nìmis~
column2: terrìbilis èst super omnes Deos. ^ For the Lord is great, and exceedingly to be praised~
column3: he is to be feared above all gods.

column2: Dòminus aŭtem caĕlos fecit. ^ For all the gods of the Gentiles are devils~
column3: but the Lord made the heavens.

column1: 6 ^ Confèssio et pulchritúdo in conspèctu ejus~
column2: sanctimónia et magnificèntia in sanctificatióne ejus. ^ Praise and beauty are before him~
column3: holiness and majesty in his sanctuary.

column1: 7 ^ Affèrte Dòmino, pátriaĕ gèntium, affèrte Dòmino glóriam et honórem. ^ Bring ye to the Lord, O ye kindreds of the Gentiles, bring ye to the Lord glory and honour.

column2: tòllite hóstias, et introíte in átria ejus. ^ Bring to the Lord glory unto his name~
column3: bring up sacrifices, and come into his courts.

column1: 9 ^ Adoráte Dòminum in átrio sancto ejus~
column2: commoveátur a fácie ejus univèrsa terra. ^ Adore ye the Lord in his holy court. Let all the earth be moved at his presence.

column1: 10 ^ Dícite in gèntibus: «~Dòminus regnávit~». Ètenim corréxit orbem terraĕ qŭi non commovébitur~
column2: judicábit pòpulos in aĕqŭitáte. ^ Say ye among the Gentiles: "the Lord hath reigned". For he hath corrected the world which shall not be moved~
column3: he will judge the people with justice.

column2: commoveátur mare, et plenitúdo ejus. ^ Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad~
column3: let the sea be moved, and the fulness thereof.

column1: 12 ^ Gaŭdébunt campi, et òmnia qŭaĕ in eîs sunt~
column2: tunc exsultábunt òmnia ligna silvárum, ^ The fields shall rejoice, and all things in them~
column3: then shall all the trees of the woods rejoice,

column1: 13 ^ a fácie Dòmini, qŭia vênit, qŭóniam vênit judicáre terram. Judicábit orbem terraĕ in aĕqŭitáte, et pòpulos in veritáte sua. ^ before the face of the Lord, because he cometh, because he cometh to judge the earth. He shall judge the world with justice, and the people with his truth.
